required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Prospective Biomechanical Analysis of Donor-site Morbidity Following Microvascular Fibula Transplantation
clinical_study.official_title: Prospective Biomechanical Analysis of Donor-site Morbidity Following Microvascular Fibula Transplantation in 27 Consecutive Cases: a Clinical Cohort Study.

brief_summary.textblock: Pre- and postoperatively patients who underwent free fibula flap were examined regarding donor-site morbidity of the lower extremities.

detailed_description.textblock: 27 patients are examined before and after microsurgical fibula flap performed at the Department of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgery, University Medical Center Hamburg Eppendorf, Germany.

primary_outcome.time_frame: 1 day before fibula transplantation and 8.3 months postoperatively on average
primary_outcome.description: Jumping Mechanography, Functional Assessment on Leonardo Mechanograph GFRP

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 day before fibula transplantation and 8.3 months postoperatively on average
secondary_outcome.description: Objective and Subjective Score for functionality and pathology of the ankle region

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 day before fibula transplantation and 8.3 months postoperatively on average
secondary_outcome.description: Functional Assessment on Leonardo Mechanograph GFRP, measures the patients' stability

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 day before fibula transplantation and 8.3 months postoperatively on average
secondary_outcome.description: Measuring Ankle Motion before and after surgery with a goniometer

intervention.description: surgical harvest of an osteomyocutaenous transplant consisting of a part of the fibula and surrounding soft tissues

study_pop.textblock: Adult patients with informed consent and that will undergo mandible resection and reconstruction via free fibula flap at the Department of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgery, University Medical Center Hamburg Eppendorf, Germany.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Planned continuity interrupting mandible resection
- Planned mandible reconstruction with free fibula flap
- Informed consent
- Procedure performed at University Medical Center Hamburg Eppendorf
Exclusion Criteria:
- Preexisting pathology/disease of the lower limbs or back (angiologic, neurologic, orthopedic)
- Musculosceletal pain at the time of study enrollment
